text:
Marriott International Hosts Spectacular Charity Gala for the Yao Foundation Published on : Monday, October 12, 2015
An unforgettable evening of live music, daring acrobatic performances by Era and gourmet “East meets West” specialties hosted by Marriott International raised RMB2,120,080 for the Yao Foundation. Marriott International has supported the Yao Foundation since 2013 which was established by former basketball player Yao Ming. The Yao Foundation is dedicated to the development of Chinese youth through education, sports skills, health and self-esteem.
Centered upon the theme of L’ABSTRACTION and staged in the Shanghai Marriott Hotel Parkview, the gala was jointly organized by Marriott hotels in Shanghai, Hangzhou, Suzhou, Kunshan, Ningbo and Changzhou.
fCraig S. Smith, President and Managing Director of Marriott International Asia Pacific (left) and Yao Ming, the founder of Yao Foundation (right) have a ball joggling competition during the gala dinner.Since recognizing Yao Foundation as its key corporate social responsibility (CSR) partner in China in 2013, Marriott International has been supporting numerous Yao Foundation community service programs. The annual black tie gala dinner is the marquee affair and has attracted over 500 corporate guests and individual sponsors.
During the 2015 gala dinner, J.W. Marriott, Jr., Executive Chairman and Chairman of the Board of Marriott International, appeared in a special video to express his gratitude to the guests, Marriott associates and Yao Foundation teams for their support of children’s education. He said: “My sincere thanks to all those who have supported and fostered growth of education in China. I am very proud of the partnership Marriott International has with Yao Foundation. Together we are connecting students in remote areas with technology and resources that can change the world. So let’s continue to equip the next generations for success.”
Craig S. Smith, President and Managing Director of Marriott International Asia Pacific, said: “It is essential for Marriott International to keep pursuing excellence in business performance, creating opportunity for our associates and supporting the communities where we work and live. This gala night celebrates both our company’s ‘Spirit to Serve’ and our commitment to hospitality.”
Yao Ming said: “Fostering children’s education is a tremendous task and we need more people to pitch in on our works. On behalf of Yao Foundation, I would like to thank Marriott International and all the sponsors of the charity dinner for their kind support to us.”
All proceeds generated from ticket sales and charity auction of the 2015 charity gala night will be donated to Yao Foundation.
For the past three years, Marriott International and Yao Foundation have been working together to organize fund-raising activities and has committed to contribute RMB 13 million to the Yao Foundation over six years to build Hope Schools in southwestern China and support the Yao Foundation Hope Primary School Basketball program. .
Top level sponsors include:
BMW, British Airways, China Calligraphers Association, China Eastern Airline, Danone, Mercedes Benz Arena, Nongfu Spring ,Summergate, United Airlines, Verve and Mengniu Dairy.
